title: Operation Sindoor was declaration of India’s self-reliance in defence sector: DRDO chief
content: “Operation Sindoor was more than a mission. It was a declaration of India’s ability to stand tall through self-reliance, strategic foresight, and indigenous technological strength. It was a statement to the world that India has the capability to protect its borders through homegrown technology,” DRDO chief Samir Kamat said

title: CPI(M) criticises Church leaders broadcasting affinity towards BJP despite Christian persecution
content: V.N. Vasavan visits the parents of Fr. Jijo, who was among the clergy targeted by the Bajrang Dal activists in Odisha, at the latter’s family home in Kuravalangadu in Kottayam

title: APMC files review petition in High Court seeking more time and clarity on July 9 judgment in FMGs’ case
content: The verdict says that Permanent Registration should be given in one month to the FMGs who compensated all practical studies that they missed during the pandemic by taking up additional offline classes

title: Women’s forum urges Assam to withdraw move on arming civilians
content: The Nari Nagarik Manch warned that the move to grant arms licences to “indigenous people in sensitive areas” will undo decades of peacebuilding and escalate tensions in the State

title: 287 more rescued as government deploys 4 choppers to evacuate people stranded in disaster-hit Uttarkashi
content: According to official data, more than 1,000 people have been evacuated so far from parts of the Dharali area which are still cut off following mudslide and flash floods on Tuesday

title: International workshop on research potential of Hortus Malabaricus begins in Thrissur
content: Meet to discuss the historical, ethnobotanical, and scientific relevance of Hortus Malabaricus — the seminal 17th-century botanical work.

title: P. Jayarajan denies discontent in CPI(M) over M.V. Govindan’s visit to astrologer
content: Visual media circulates photograph of Govindan’s meeting with Madhava Poduval, a well-known astrologer, who is known for close ties across political lines

title: Kerala’s Muthuvan tribe comes together to protect their language, culture
content: Community organises three-day assembly as part of the International Day of the World’s Indigenous Peoples

title: Giving back land and life
content: The Gujarat police are helping borrowers crushed by loan sharks to reclaim their property and their peace of mind; In first six months of 2025, 315 cases registered against 756 moneylenders, arresting 638 of them for operating illegally and 23 people were arrested in Amreli district

title: Police register fresh case against father for ‘selling’ another girl child too
content: Mastan allegedly sold her for ₹30,000 to a couple from Vetapalem village two years ago, alleges wife

title: New freshwater crabs discovered in the Western Ghats in Kerala
content: The new species belong to the freshwater crab family Gecarcinucidae. While Kasargodia sheebae was spotted in the Ranipuram Hill Station in  Kasaragod district, the specimen of Pilarta vaman was collected from a small mountain stream at Gavi.

title: Naidu fabricated liquor scandal to settle scores with YSRCP cadre, alleges Tirupati MP
content: Gurumoorthy calls recent ₹11 crore seizure in Telangana a diversion tactic and condemns the arrest of YSRCP Lok Sabha Floor Leader Midhun Reddy

title: Trains cancelled, regulated, rescheduled for Vande Bharat launch in Bengaluru on August 10
content: PM Modi to inaugurate Karnataka’s first Vande Bharat train and the Yellow Line of Namma Metro, the South Western Railway on August 10

title: ‘UNDP Equator Initiative Award’ for Bibi Fatima SHG of Teertha village
content: The SHG made remarkable achievements in areas of implementing eco-friendly farming practices in rainfed lands, managing community seed banks, ensuring food and nutrition security, and promoting millet cultivation

title: 'Ghost of Balakot’ laid to rest: Air Force chief on why videos of Operation Sindoor matter - watch
content: Air Force Chief Marshal AP Singh voiced his regret over the absence of video evidence from the 2019 Balakot airstrike, which fueled doubts among opposition leaders regarding its effectiveness. He highlighted that Operation Sindoor addressed this issue by providing recorded footage of airstrikes, effectively dispelling the "ghost of Balakot.

title: 1 yr of RG Kar incident: 'Bangles broken' - Victim's mother's big charge against WB cops
content: Kolkata witnessed police action against protesters during the ‘Nabanna Abhijan’ march. The rally commemorated the anniversary of a doctor's rape and murder at RG Kar Medical College. The victim's family alleged police obstruction despite court permission. Opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari urged BJP workers to join. Security measures included barricades and traffic halts.

title: 'Badi deewar gir gayi hai': Families recall Delhi wall collapse horror; 7 killed
content: In Jaitpur, a wall collapsed near Mohan Baba Mandir due to heavy rain, killing five members of Ranjan's family and trapping eight people in jhuggis. The victims included two children, a woman, and several migrant workers from West Bengal. Police are investigating the structural condition of the wall and potential negligence, while one survivor receives treatment.

title: Former Pakistan pacer makes massive Siraj admission: 'He's not just ...'
content: Wasim Akram hails Mohammed Siraj's transformation from a support bowler to India's pace spearhead after his match-winning performance at the Oval. Siraj's nine wickets helped India level the series against England, showcasing his stamina and mental fortitude by bowling over 185 overs.

title: Data network outage at Mumbai airport: Flight operations hit; Air India issues advisory
content: Air India reported that a data network outage at Mumbai Airport disrupted check-in systems, causing flight delays, including its own. While the issue has been resolved, Air India cautioned that some flights might still experience delays as operations gradually return to normal.

title: Nvidia CEO visits White House to seek licenses for 'designed-for China' AI chips
content: Nvidia's CEO, Jensen Huang, reportedly lobbied President Trump, leading to the US Commerce Department issuing licenses for H20 AI chips designed for China, reversing an earlier stricter stance. Security officials are concerned about potential military strengthening in China, while Nvidia argues restrictions hinder US competitiveness and boost domestic Chinese alternatives like Huawei.

title: Watch: Siraj, Asha Bhosle's granddaughter Zanai celebrate Rakhi together
content: Mohammed Siraj celebrated Raksha Bandhan with Zanai Bhosle, clarifying their brother-sister bond after dating rumors. Siraj's impressive performance on the England tour, where he took 23 wickets, has garnered praise. Wasim Akram lauded Siraj's passion and stamina, noting his evolution into a leading bowler for the Indian team, showcasing remarkable mental strength.

title: Hezbollah military facility explosion: 5 soldiers killed while clearing munitions
content: Five Lebanese soldiers tragically died in an explosion at a Hezbollah military facility near Majdal Zoun, Tyre district, while clearing munitions left over from the recent conflict with Israel. The facility was being dismantled by the Lebanese army under a November truce agreement.

title: 'Shot Pak plane from 300 km': IAF chief's big update on Op Sindoor - key revelations
content: IAF chief Amar Preet Singh revealed Operation Sindoor inflicted significant damage on Pakistan, including the downing of six aircraft, among them five fighter jets and a high-value surveillance platform. The operation targeted command and control centers, radar systems, and aircraft hangars, effectively addressing the 'ghost of Balakot' by showcasing tangible achievements and losses inflicted on the adversary.

title: Nvidia CEO checks salaries of company's 42,000 employees; says: It's a strategy that…
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally reviews the compensation of all 42,000 employees monthly, utilizing machine learning to optimize the process. He dismisses rumors of secret stock options, emphasizing generous compensation for all workers. Huang believes in prioritizing employee well-being, which he feels drives overall success. This strategy has significantly benefited Nvidia's leadership, creating billionaires within his management team.

title: ‘They label kanwariyas as terrorists’: BJP calls Samajwadi Party ‘communal’
content: The BJP has criticized the Samajwadi Party (SP), labeling it a "communal party" after former SP MP ST Hasan linked the Uttarkashi flash floods to religious intolerance in Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh. Hasan suggested a lack of respect for other religions contributed to the disaster, while the BJP condemned his remarks as insulting to Sanatan Dharma amidst a natural calamity.

title: WTC Table: How the standings look as NZ crush Zim – Where does India stand?
content: New Zealand's massive innings victory over Zimbabwe in Bulawayo, though impressive, doesn't affect the current ICC World Test Championship standings as Zimbabwe isn't part of the cycle. India currently holds third place, while Australia leads the table.

title: US-India trade war: What triggered Trump's tariff attack on India - key reasons
content: Donald Trump's administration has escalated trade tensions with India, imposing tariffs due to energy ties with Russia and stalled trade negotiations. This move, coupled with disagreements over diplomatic interventions and strategic alignments, has strained US-India relations. India is cautiously navigating this complex situation, balancing economic interests with its commitment to strategic autonomy and an independent foreign policy.

title: GTA 6 release date set for May 2026: Innovative gameplay promises new thrills
content: Grand Theft Auto 6 is slated for a May 26, 2026, release, fueling excitement tempered by Rockstar's history of delays. While Take-Two Interactive anticipates significant revenue driven by GTA 6, the game's pricing may reflect the rising costs of AAA titles. Players can anticipate an expansive open-world experience with innovative gameplay and a compelling narrative.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Faissal's latest revelation, Kohli's beard worries netizens & more
content: Faissal Khan revealed his exclusion from 'The Kapil Sharma Show' appearance with Aamir Khan. Meanwhile, Virat Kohli's grey beard sparked varied reactions as he enjoys family time in London. Boney Kapoor shared a touching throwback photo of Sridevi ahead of her birth anniversary. Sooraj Barjatya hinted at Salman Khan's return as Prem in a future film.

title: England cricket legend Pietersen reveals ‘best Test series ever played’
content: Kevin Pietersen's declaration immortalises the 2005 Ashes as his career highlight and the greatest Test series ever. England's triumph, fueled by Pietersen's explosive century and a resilient team effort, marked a defining moment against a formidable Australian side. The series, filled with narrow victories and dramatic performances, etched itself into cricketing history, showcasing courage and flair.

title: 'Makes it even more shocking...': Cong questions PM after IAF chief's Op Sindoor revelations
content: Following the IAF chief's disclosure about Operation Sindoor, Congress leaders are questioning Prime Minister Modi's decision to halt the operation abruptly on May 10. Jairam Ramesh and Gaurav Gogoi have demanded answers regarding potential pressure or concessions influencing the decision.

title: McDavid and Lauren Kyle steal the show at Draisaitl’s fairytale wedding
content: Connor McDavid and Lauren Kyle captivated fans with their charm and elegance at a Provence wedding, overshadowing rumors of another NHL star's nuptials. Lauren's Instagram posts offered a genuine glimpse into the dreamy festivities, showcasing understated style and heartfelt moments. Fans celebrated the couple's natural chemistry and the weekend's blend of style, love, and authentic connection.

title: Tyreek Hill, ex Keeta Vaccaro rush baby Capri to ER; now recovering
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: Navratilova: Chris Evert’s Catholic upbringing shaped her tennis image
content: Martina Navratilova's comments sparked renewed interest in Chris Evert. Navratilova suggested Evert's strict Catholic upbringing shaped her public image. She contrasted this with her own experiences growing up in Czechoslovakia. Navratilova noted Evert's desire to please her parents influenced her behavior. The remarks added a new layer to their famous rivalry. Their contrasting styles fueled tennis's growth.

title: Raksha Bandhan with the PM: Modi shares cute moment with children - pics
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Raksha Bandhan at his residence, sharing joyful moments with school children and members of Brahma Kumari. He conveyed greetings on X, highlighting the festival's role in strengthening sibling bonds. Union home minister Amit Shah and defence minister Rajnath Singh also extended wishes, emphasising the festival's significance in love, trust, protection, and commitment.

title: Samson wishes to leave RR because of 14-yo Vaibhav Suryavanshi?
content: Aakash Chopra speculates Sanju Samson's possible departure from Rajasthan Royals before the 2026 IPL auction, potentially influenced by Vaibhav Suryavanshi's emergence. Samson's desire to leave stems from team dynamics, with Kolkata Knight Riders emerging as a likely destination due to their need for an Indian wicketkeeper-batter and captaincy option. Chopra suggests roster changes to accommodate Samson at KKR.

title: Virat Kohli's goodbye gift that Mohammed Siraj will never forget
content: Mohammed Siraj treasures Virat Kohli's last Test jersey as a symbol of their deep bond, forged through shared battles and mutual respect. Kohli's mentorship transformed Siraj from a rookie into a key bowler for India. The jersey represents their friendship, loyalty, and Kohli's lasting impact on Siraj's career, inspiring both on and off the field.

title: 1 dead as fire breaks out at Delhi’s Anand Vihar hospital; 11 patients rescued
content: A fire erupted at a New Delhi hospital in Anand Vihar on Saturday due to a short circuit, triggering blasts in oxygen cylinders. The ensuing thick smoke compelled hospital staff to evacuate patients to Pushpanjali Hospital after breaking windows. Emergency services responded swiftly, and an investigation is currently underway to determine the exact cause of the incident.

title: ICICI bank raises minimum balance for new customers: Rs 50,000 in cities
content: ICICI Bank has raised the minimum average balance requirement for new savings accounts opened from August 1st. The new MAB is Rs 50,000 for metro/urban, Rs 25,000 for semi-urban, and Rs 10,000 for rural locations.

title: Record! NZ seal biggest Test victory; Zimbabwe suffer worst-ever defeat
content: New Zealand dominated Zimbabwe, securing their largest-ever Test victory by an innings and 359 runs, completing a 2-0 series sweep. Debutant Zakary Foulkes starred with a remarkable 9-75, setting a new record for a New Zealand bowler on debut. Zimbabwe struggled against New Zealand's pace attack, succumbing to their lowest series total, highlighting the gulf between the two teams.

title: IAF chief says India shot down 6 Pakistani aircraft; trashes Trump's claim
content: Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh revealed that the Indian Air Force (IAF) successfully shot down five Pakistani jets and an AEW&C aircraft during Operation Sindoor. Speaking at a memorial lecture in Bengaluru, Singh's statement marks the first official confirmation of the extent of damage inflicted on Pakistani aircraft during the cross-border anti-terror operation.

title: From Iyer to Pant: India cricketers celebrate Raksha Bandhan - pics inside
content: Raksha Bandhan celebrations saw Indian cricket stars like Rishabh Pant and Shreyas Iyer spending time with their sisters. They shared heartwarming pictures on social media. Sakshi Pant tied rakhi to Rishabh. Shreyas Iyer posted a picture with his sister, Shresta Iyer. These moments showed the importance of family for these athletes.

title: 'Heard of Laapataa Ladies not of laapataa VP': Sibal on Dhankhar's whereabouts
content: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal has voiced concerns over the whereabouts of former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar, noting his absence from public view since his resignation on July 22, citing health reasons. Sibal urged Home Minister Amit Shah to address the matter, highlighting Dhankhar's incommunicado status and suggesting the possibility of filing a habeas corpus petition.

title: Gold again! Gukesh, Pranav and now this — Velammal keeps minting talents
content: Velammal MHS School's chess team triumphed at the 2025 World Schools Team Championship, continuing India's chess dominance. The Chennai-based institution, known for nurturing chess talent like GMs D Gukesh and R Praggnanandhaa, provides academic flexibility and professional coaching. Velammal's success, fueled by Chennai's chess culture and support for players, solidifies its reputation as a "Chess Factory."

title: NYC Times Square shooting: 3 injured in gunfire after ‘verbal dispute’
content: Early Saturday morning, a shooting in Times Square injured three individuals following a dispute. The New York Police Department reported that a 17-year-old male suspect was apprehended at the scene, and a firearm was recovered. The victims, a 65-year-old man, a 19-year-old man, and an 18-year-old woman, are in stable condition at Bellevue Hospital.

title: Dharali flash floods: FIR against 5 for 'Nature's bulldozer' comment
content: Dehradun police have registered a case against five individuals, including one unidentified person, for allegedly posting and commenting on a Facebook update about the Dharali flash floods. The post, captioned "this is nature's bulldozer," along with the comments, is accused of hurting religious sentiments and promoting enmity.

title: Udaipur shocker: Woman, mother-in-law burnt alive after dispute
content: In a tragic incident in Udaipur's Jindoli village, a woman, Mangi Gameti, and her mother-in-law, Pappa Bai, died after Mangi set herself on fire following a domestic dispute with her husband. The fire rapidly spread due to inflammable materials in the room, trapping both women.

title: Ahmedabad woman gets 2 years in jail for throwing baby from 9th floor
content: An Ahmedabad court convicted a 25-year-old woman to two years in jail for concealing the birth and disposing of her newborn child's body. Residents of Skywalk Society discovered the infant's body in April 2023, suspecting it was thrown from the ninth floor. While charged with murder, the prosecution failed to prove intent.

title: Drowning Delhi: Flooded roads, stuck cars and soaked capital - heavy rains lash city
content: Delhi was severely affected by incessant heavy rains, leading to widespread waterlogging and traffic disruptions across key areas like Vasant Kunj and Connaught Place. The India Meteorological Department initially issued a red alert, which was later downgraded to yellow, forecasting continued thunderstorms until August 12. The city recorded significant rainfall, with Safdarjung reporting 78.7 mm.

title: 'Will not give land to occupier': Zelenskyy rules out ceding Ukraine territory to Russia
content: As Trump and Putin prepare for a summit in Alaska, Zelenskyy insists that no decisions about Ukraine should be made without Ukraine's involvement. He firmly rejects ceding any territory to Russia, emphasizing that Ukrainians will not give their land to the occupier. Zelenskyy believes that any agreement excluding Ukraine is doomed to fail and will not bring lasting peace.

title: Delhi restaurant owner apologises after couple denied entry over Indian attire
content: Following outrage over a Delhi restaurant allegedly denying entry to a couple for wearing Indian attire, Tourism Minister Kapil Mishra reported that the owner has apologized and will offer Rakshabandhan discounts for women in traditional wear. An investigation was launched after a video surfaced showing the couple's complaint.

title: Injured vs India, Woakes mulls risky rehab — 'A risk you’re willing to take'
content: England's Chris Woakes faced a tough decision regarding his injured shoulder, sustained during the fifth Test against India. He is contemplating rehab to potentially avoid surgery, aiming for a quicker return and a chance to participate in the Ashes series in Australia later this year. Woakes' determination to play is evident, highlighted by his courageous batting display despite the injury.

title: Bengaluru: Man slits throat of 14-year-old nephew over demand for gaming phone
content: In Bengaluru, a 55-year-old security guard confessed to murdering his 14-year-old nephew after an argument over money for a mobile game. Naga Prasad surrendered to police after a failed suicide attempt, leading to the discovery of the teenager's body in his rented room. Prasad admitted to slitting his nephew's throat due to his constant demands and arrogant behavior.

title: Bazball's revolution: How England's bold era is tilting Test cricket towards the batters
content: Since Brendon McCullum's arrival, England's Test cricket has transformed with 'Bazball,' marked by aggressive play and high win rates. This shift coincides with flatter pitches, favouring batters and potentially diminishing the traditional advantage for seam bowlers. While entertaining and popular, this approach raises concerns about the long-term balance of Test cricket, as bowler-friendly conditions become increasingly scarce.

title: 12-year-old boy pours boiling water on sleeping younger brother; prank goes wrong
content: In a disturbing incident, a 12-year-old boy in Lancaster Township inflicted severe burns on his nine-year-old brother by pouring hot water on him as he slept, mimicking a dangerous "Hot Water Challenge" seen on social media. The younger brother was hospitalized with burns to his neck and chest. This incident highlights the perilous consequences of social media stunts, echoing past cases where children have suffered serious injuries.

title: 'Wanted to see how it works': Passenger opens emergency exit cover mid-takeoff
content: An Akasa Airlines flight from Varanasi to Bengaluru faced a delay when a passenger, Ajay Tiwari, mistakenly opened the emergency exit handle cover. The incident occurred as the flight was preparing for takeoff, prompting its return to the apron for safety checks.

title: Rakhi with donor’s hand: Mumbai teen meets her ‘new brother’ in Gujarat
content: In a poignant Raksha Bandhan celebration in Gujarat, Anamta Ahmad, recipient of a hand transplant from the late Riya Mistry, tied a rakhi to Riya's brother, Shivam. This emotional meeting connected two families bound by grief and gratitude, as Anamta became a living embodiment of Riya's legacy. The gesture highlighted the profound impact of organ donation, uniting tradition and humanity.

title: Eastern Ukraine in exchange for peace? Putin's demand ahead of meeting with Trump
content: Donald Trump will meet Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15, 2025, to negotiate a potential end to the Russia-Ukraine war. Putin is reportedly seeking control over eastern Ukraine, specifically Luhansk, Donetsk, Zaporizhzhia, and Kherson, along with global recognition of Russia's claims, in exchange for a ceasefire. Trump anticipates territory swaps as part of any peace agreement.

title: Railways launches 20% rebate on return tickets to ease Diwali-Chhath festival rush
content: To ease Diwali and Chhath rush, railways introduces a 'Round Trip Package' offering a 20% fare rebate on return journeys booked together. Bookings open August 14, 2025, for onward travel between October 13-26, 2025, and return travel between November 17-December 1. The scheme aims to manage passenger traffic, improve train utilization, and benefit passengers planning extended vacations.

title: Why are Trump, Putin meeting in Alaska and will Zelenskyy be present?
content: Donald Trump is set to meet Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15, 2025, aiming to broker a peace deal to end the Ukraine war. Trump believes he has "a shot" at securing peace, hinting at possible territory swaps. The meeting follows a visit by Trump’s envoy to Moscow, though Russia dismissed a three-way summit with Zelenskyy.

title: Triple murder in Delhi: Man kills wife, daughters in Karawal Nagar; accused absconding
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Karawal Nagar, police are actively searching for a man named Pradeep, who is suspected of murdering his wife, Jaya Shri, and their two young daughters, aged five and seven. Preliminary investigations suggest that ongoing marital disputes may have been a contributing factor in this horrific crime.

title: Evacuation In Disaster-Hit Uttarakashi Underway, 816 Rescued So Far
content: After the devastating flash-floods that hit Dharali and Harsil, 816 civilians have been rescued by the Indian Army, Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP), National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), and State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) till Saturday

title: 6 Pak Aircraft Shot Down During Op Sindoor, Says Air Force Chief
content: Six Pakistani aircraft - including five fighter jets and another large aircraft - were downed during Operation Sindoor, the Indian Air Force has confirmed.

title: 2-Year-Old Dies Boy After Falling Into Sewer In Delhi
content: A two-and-a-half-year old boy died after falling into an open sewer in outer north Delhi's Khera Khurd village amid heavy rain Saturday morning, police said.

title: Chaos At RG Kar Protest: Victim's Parents Injured, Taken To Hospital
content: The parents of the RG Kar rape and murder victim have claimed that they roughed up by the state police this morning during a protest march to Nabanna, the state secretariat that houses the office of Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee.

title: Won't Surrender Land To Buy Peace: Zelensky After US, Russia Agree To Summit
content: Ukraine won't surrender land to Russia to buy peace, President Volodymyr Zelensky warned Saturday, after Washington and Moscow agreed to hold a summit in a bid to end the war.

title: Sharad Pawar Claims 'Seat Guarantee' Offered Ahead Of Polls, D Fadnavis Says...
content: Sharad Pawar has claimed that ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly elections, two individuals approached him offering a "guarantee" of 160 seats for the Maha Vikas Aghadi, well above the 145 needed for a majority in the House.

title: "Will Make An Example Of Them": Iran Arrests 20 Alleged Israeli Spies
content: Iran has arrested 20 people it alleges are operatives of Israel's Mossad spy agency in recent months, the judiciary said on Saturday, warning that they will face no leniency and will be made an example of.

title: Assam Man's 25-Year Vintage Collection Now A Unique Museum
content: A government employee in Assam has transformed a 25-year passion for collecting vintage items into a unique private museum.

title: Waterslide Horror On World's Largest Cruise Ship, Screams Heard In Video
content: A terrifying incident unfolded on Royal Caribbean's Icon of the Seas when a waterslide suddenly cracked open mid-ride, leaving one injured.

title: 1 Dead, 10 Injured As Fire Breaks Out In Delhi Hospital
content: A fire broke out at Anand Vihar Hospital in east Delhi on Saturday afternoon, leaving one person dead and at least 10 injured, Delhi Fire Service officials said.

title: Sharad Pawar's '160 Seats Offer' Claim Follows Rahul Gandhi's Big Charge
content: Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi's allegations of vote theft in Karnataka during the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and the explosive claims against the Election Commission have found support from NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar.

title: Some Nations Will Make "Titanic Efforts" To Disrupt Putin-Trump Meeting: Russia
content: Certain countries will make "titanic efforts" to disrupt the meeting US President Donald Trump announced on Friday with Russian President Vladimir Putin for August 15, Russia's investment envoy Kirill Dmitriev said on Saturday.

title: North Korea Taking Down Loudspeakers From Border, Says South Korea
content: South Korea's military detected North Korea removing some of its loudspeakers from the inter-Korean border, days after the South dismantled its front-line speakers used for anti-North Korean propaganda broadcasts.

title: How Indian-Origin Restaurant Owner In UK Played Detective After Burglary
content: Ankit Vaghela, restaurant owner in Southampton had to play detective after police failed to attend to a break-in at his business. His restaurant, called 'Padharo', is a popular vegetarian spot on East Street.

title: "BrahMos Was Primary Offensive Weapon": DRDO Chief On Op Sindoor
content: India's Operation Sindoor that destroyed terror infrastructure and military assets deep inside Pakistan was a declaration of the country's ability to defend itself using homegrown technology, DRDO chief Samir Kamat said.

title: Bengaluru Cop Suspended After Thief In Custody Wears Uniform To Impress Wife
content: A mistake made a year ago has caused trouble for Bengaluru police after a thief wore a constable’s uniform during a video call to his wife.

title: Odisha Nurse, About To Go Home For Raksha Bandhan, Found Dead In Hospital
content: An nurse was found dead inside the bathroom of a private hospital in Odisha under mysterious circumstances, hours before she was to go home to celebrate Raksha Bandhan.

title: Influencer Wife Defends Pakistan Man Who Threatened To Rape Air Hostess
content: Former British executive Salman Iftikhar, who has been jailed for threatening to kill and rape a Virgin Atlantic flight attendant, has received support from his wife.

title: Congress Claims Credit For Bengaluru Metro Yellow Line, Set To Be Inaugurated By PM Tomorrow
content: Bengaluru's much-awaited Metro Yellow Line is set to be inaugurated tomorrow by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. But before the event, the political battle over credit for the project has heated up.

title: The RG Kar Horror: When The "Safest City" Stood In Silence
content: A year ago, on this day, the rape and murder of a young doctor at a state-run hospital in Kolkata had exposed the worst fears of the women working night shifts in the city known to be the safest among metros.

title: Panjapur bus terminus in Tiruchi has modern amenities but no space for autorickshaw stand
content: The elderly and those with luggage struggle to navigate through the haphazardly parked vehicles amid the chaos while autorickshaw drivers say they are struggling as commuters prefer to travel by city buses to Central and Chanthiram bus stands

title: Coir sector gets boost with fibre bank, wage hike
content: ₹10 crore sanctioned as a revolving fund for the purpose. If funds are made available on time, coir production in the State could be increased by 50%, says P. Rajeeve.

title: MCD to issue advisory against feeding pigeons amid health concerns
content: The advisory will request public cooperation in avoiding feeding pigeons on the roads, footpaths, traffic islands, balconies and terraces

title: ‘Why stopped Operation Sindoor?’ Congress asks PM Modi after Air Chief’s revelation on Pakistani planes hit
content: Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh said in Bengaluru that the IAF shot down five Pakistani fighter jets and a large aircraft during Operation Sindoor

title: Rythu Coolie Sangham rallies for scheduled area status and tribal rights in Andhra Pradesh
content: On Adivasi Day, the association demands PESA Act implementation, improved connectivity, land rights for long-time tribal cultivators, and an exclusive DSC for tribal graduates, citing years of government neglect

title: Odisha CM Majhi distributes ₹5,000 crore to one crore women under Subhadra scheme
content: Among the beneficiaries, 1,783 women are from Kotia panchayat in Koraput district near the Andhra Pradesh border, Mr. Majhi said

title: India, Oman free trade agreement likely to be announced soon: Official
content: The talks for the agreement, officially termed the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA), formally began in November 2023

title: Electricity, a ‘public good’, must not be vulnerable to ‘undue political posturing’, says Supreme Court
content: The judgment raises questions on the autonomy of Electricity Regulatory Commissions, which have the exclusive power to fix power tariffs

title: Low-floor buses with several modern features to hit the road in Tiruchi soon
content: Ten of the 25 low-floor buses allotted for Tiruchi region to become operational soon; the buses are fitted with rear view cameras, automatic gearboxes, blind spot mirrors, and fire detection system

title: Filed breach of privilege complaint against Jharkhand officials: Nishikant Dubey after FIR against him
content: “I am the trustee of Baba Baidyanath Dham as a Member of Parliament, as per the law. I am in a higher position than the priest. On what basis was the FIR lodged?” Mr. Dubey said

title: Second edition of International Science Film Festival begins in Thrissur
content: Eminent scientist M.P. Parameswaran inaugurates the event at a function held at Thrissur Model Girls High School

title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests seven Indian fishermen from Rameswaram
content: On charges of crossing the IMBL, a Sri Lankan Navy patrol boat stopped the fishermen for questioning. Subsequently, they arrested them

title: 51 anganwadis in Ernakulam yet to receive fitness certificates
content: While fitness certifiication is usually done between April-June coinciding with the start of the new academic year, the delay in these 51 anganwadis has been attributed to the non-availability of assistant engineers

title: Religious content in Hindi alphabet charts at school sparks row; probe ordered
content: Baby Convent School principal I.A. Qureshi allegedly handed Hindi alphabet charts mentioning 'Ka' for Kaba, 'Ma' for Masjid and 'Na' for Namaz to students

title: Uttarkashi floods: Uttarakhand CM Dhami announces ₹5 lakh immediate assistance for victims
content: Mr. Dhami announced the formation of a three-member committee for rehabilitation, overall revival, and strengthening of sustainable livelihood of villagers affected by the disaster

title: Palaniswami’s criticism of T.N’s economic growth stems from DMK’s achievements, says CM Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin said his government was taking Tamil Nadu on the path of development with achievements that even the Union government, led by the BJP, an ally of the AIADMK, could not hide or deny

title: PM Modi celebrates Raksha Bandhan with students, members of Brahma Kumari and others
content: The Prime Minister shared a video clip of the celebration as a bunch of happy young students shared their joy and sentiments

title: Kanthapuram requests special prayers for Gaza after sunset on Monday
content: Suggests that people observe a fast on Monday, if possible, before offering the special prayer for Gaza; expresses angst and pain over the implementation of a genocide plan in Gaza

title: Low yields, poor rains dampen tomato cultivation in Madanapalle
content: Madanapalle revenue division is considered Asia’s largest tomato-producing belt with a traditional cultivation area running into 15,000 acres

title: Tripura Assembly Speaker under 72-hour observation post brain surgery
content: Mr. Sen (72) suffered head injuries in the lavatory of the Agartala Railway Station on Friday evening before his scheduled journey to Dharmanagar in north Tripura, his home constituency

title: Fourth-grader’s ordeal spurs statewide action for child protection in Kerala
content: As part of the Suraksha Mithram project, a ‘help box’ will be installed in all schools for children to confidentially record their complaints and distressing experiences.

title: Congress launches hunger strike in Srinagar demanding restoration of J&K statehood
content: The strike was launched by Jammu and Kashmir Pradesh Congress Committee (JKPCC) president Tariq Karra at the party's head office at M A Road in Srinagar

title: Three killed in explosion at illegal fireworks unit in Virudhunagar; T.N. CM Stalin announces solatium
content: At around 11.30 a.m., a massive blast was reported from the dwelling and when the neighbours rushed to the spot in the next few minutes, they found that three people had died, and a woman had sustained burn injuries

title: Railways announces 20% discount on return journey tickets for festival season
content: The discount will be on tickets booked from August 14, and the rebate will not be applicable on flexi fare trains such as Rajdhani, Shatabdi, Duranto, etc

title: Inquiry by Law Department into alleged vote fraud, says Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah orders inquiry into alleged vote fraud during Lok Sabha elections based on Rahul Gandhi’s suggestion

title: Heavy rainfall alert in 13 Telangana districts for August 10
content: Thunderstorms accompanied with lightning and gusty winds are very likely to occur in all 33 districts of the State

title: Government arm-twisting villagers for Siang mega dam: Congress in Arunachal
content: A forum of farmers in the Siang River belt is opposed to the proposed dam reportedly pursued by India as a counterweight to China’s planned Medog dam on the Yarlung Tsangpo upstream

title: Four killed, seven severely injured in road accident near Chakicherla in Nellore district of Andhra Pradesh
content: Several ministers of the State have expressed their condolences to the family members of the deceased

title: BJP spokesperson expelled over criticism of party's 'treatment' of Dhankhar, Satyapal Malik
content: Party insiders said Krishna Kumar Janu’s remarks were viewed as damaging to the BJP’s image and internal discipline

title: R.G. Kar incident: Victim’s parents allege police assault during march to Nabanna
content: Leader of Opposition in West Bengal Assembly Suvendu Adhikari along with other BJP leaders participated in the protest march and said 100 persons sustained injuries in police action

title: Training aircraft crash-lands near Baramati airport; no injuries
content: The incident occurred when the aircraft, owned by Redbird Flight Training Centre, was landing after completing a training sortie

title: Election Commission of India delists 334 registered unrecognised political parties for failure to follow norms
content: Out of the total 2,854 registered unrecognised political parties, 2,520 remain after the cleanup exercise

title: State Bar Councils, BCI cannot charge any 'optional' fee from enrolling lawyers: Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court directs State Bar Councils to stop collecting optional fees from law graduates, ensuring compliance with court orders

title: Ahead of the Bihar election, Tejashwi Yadav pens a message to sisters of Bihar on the day of Rakshabandhan
content: Mr. Yadav urged them to teach a lesson to the NDA government by defeating them and their negative politics to form the Mahagathbandhan government in Bihar.

title: Election Commission should look into Rahul Gandhi's 'vote theft' presentation: Sharad Pawar
content: "We will never align with a BJP-led alliance," said Sharad Pawar; addressing a press conference in Nagpur, Mr. Pawar admitted that the Opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi should have been more careful on "vote theft"  before the elections in Maharashtra

title: Five Pakistani fighter jets, one aircraft taken down during Operation Sindoor: IAF Chief
content: Indian Air Force Chief Marshal A.P. Singh said that two main reasons for the success of Operation Sindoor are the “political will” and the “free hand given to the Armed forces” to carry out the attack

title: No claim or objection submitted by any party on draft electoral rolls: ECI
content: So far, after over a week since the beginning of the Claims and Objections period, not even a single claim or objection has been submitted by any political party, says the Elelction Commission

title: Shah's August 29 visit to start process of BJP's political narrative building for 2026 Assam polls: CM
content: The BJP and its allies will seek to form the government for the third successive term in the state in next year’s assembly polls

title: Congress says its entire top leadership was jailed during Quit India movement but RSS opposed it
content: On the 83rd anniversary of the Quit India movement, the Congress alleged that while the Congress leadership at the time languished in jails, the RSS opposed the movement

title: Lions' Norris stable after injury ends game early
content: A preseason game between the Lions and Falcons was suspended in the fourth quarter after Detroit safety Morice Norris was taken off the field in an ambulance.

title: Yanks' Williams on latest loss: 'I stink right now'

title: Geno, Crosby flash obscene gestures at hecklers
content: Raiders quarterback Geno Smith and defensive end Maxx Crosby were caught on video making obscene gestures toward Seahawks fans.

title: Wrexham stunned by late Southampton goals

title: Jackson, No. 8 in ESPNW 100, commits to Terps
content: Jordyn Jackson, the No. 8 player in the 2026 ESPNW 100 class, has committed to Maryland, she announced Saturday.

title: Kershaw outduels Scherzer in matchup of greats
